NEM, TSX&#58; NGT, ASX&#58; NEM, PNGX&#58; NEM </font><font style="color:#0c2b82;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:115%"> </font></div></td><td colspan="3" style="padding:2px 1pt;text-align:left;vertical-align:bottom"><div style="text-align:right"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:700;line-height:100%">&#160;Exhibit 99.1</font></div></td></tr></table></div><div style="margin-bottom:9pt"><font style="color:#0c2b82;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:14pt;font-weight:700;line-height:120%">Newmont Reports First Quarter 2024 Results</font></div><div style="margin-bottom:6pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:400;line-height:115%">DENVER, April&#160;25, 2024 &#8211; Newmont Corporation (NYSE&#58; NEM, TSX&#58; NGT, ASX&#58; NEM, PNGX&#58; NEM) (Newmont or the Company) today announced first quarter 2024 results and declared a first quarter dividend of $0.25 per share.</font></div><div style="margin-bottom:6pt"><font><br></font></div><div><font style="color:#0c2b82;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">&#34;Newmont delivered a strong first quarter operational performance, producing 2.2 million gold equivalent ounces and generating over $1.4 billion in cash from operations before working capital changes,&#34; said Tom Palmer, Newmont's President and Chief Executive Officer. &#34;Underpinned by the gold industry's leading portfolio of Tier 1 gold and copper operations, we remain well-positioned to achieve our full-year guidance and deliver meaningful synergies and productivity improvements from the combined portfolio. We remain focused on delivering on the commitments we laid out at the beginning of this year, creating an attractive value proposition for new and existing investors during this unique time in the gold industry.&#34;</font></div><div style="margin-bottom:3pt;margin-top:12pt"><font><br></font></div><div style="margin-bottom:3pt;margin-top:12pt"><font style="color:#0c2b82;font-family:'Open style="margin-bottom:6pt;margin-top:6pt;padding-left:36pt;text-indent:-18pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open for the first quarter of 2024</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open ounces from Newmont's Tier 1 Portfolio</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open ounce of $1,439&#59; Newmont's Tier 1 Portfolio reported CAS of $1,000 per ounce and AISC of $1,378 per ounce</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open See notes at the end of this release.</font></div><div><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:3.9pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:115%;position:relative;top:-2.1pt;vertical-align:baseline">2</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:6pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:115%"> Newmont's Board of Directors declared a dividend of $0.25 per share of common stock for the first quarter of 2024, payable on June 27, 2024 to holders of record at the close of business on June 4, 2024.</font></div><div><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:3.9pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:115%;position:relative;top:-2.1pt;vertical-align:baseline">3</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:6pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:115%"> Gold equivalent ounces (GEOs) calculated using Gold (</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:6pt;font-weight:400;line-height:115%">$1,400</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:6pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:115%">&#47;oz.), Copper (</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:6pt;font-weight:400;line-height:115%">$3.50</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:6pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:115%">&#47;lb.), Silver (</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:6pt;font-weight:400;line-height:115%">$20.00</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:6pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:115%">&#47;oz.), Lead (</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:6pt;font-weight:400;line-height:115%">$1.00</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:6pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:115%">&#47;lb.) and Zinc (</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:6pt;font-weight:400;line-height:115%">$1.20</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:6pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:115%">&#47;lb.) pricing for 2024.</font></div><div><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:3.9pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:115%;position:relative;top:-2.1pt;vertical-align:baseline">4</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:6pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:115%"> Newmont&#8217;s go-forward portfolio is focused on Tier 1 assets, consisting of (1) six managed Tier 1 assets (Boddington, Tanami, Cadia, Lihir, Pe&#241;asquito and Ahafo), (2) assets owned through two non-managed joint ventures at Nevada Gold Mines and Pueblo Viejo, including four Tier 1 assets (Carlin, Cortez, Turquoise Ridge and Pueblo Viejo), (3) three emerging Tier 1 assets (Merian, Cerro Negro and Yanacocha), which do not currently meet the criteria for Tier 1 Asset, and (4) an emerging Tier 1 district in the Golden Triangle in British Columbia (Red Chris and Brucejack), which does not currently meet the criteria for Tier 1 Asset. Newmont&#8217;s Tier 1 portfolio also includes attributable production from the Company&#8217;s equity interest in Lundin Gold (Fruta del Norte). Tier 1 Portfolio cost and capital metrics include the proportional share of the Company&#8217;s interest in the Nevada Gold Mines joint venture.</font></div><div><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:3.9pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:115%;position:relative;top:-2.1pt;vertical-align:baseline">5 </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:6pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:115%">Non-GAAP metrics&#59; see reconciliations at the end of this release.</font></div><div><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:3.9pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:115%;position:relative;top:-2.1pt;vertical-align:baseline">6</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:6pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:115%"> Synergies are a management estimate provided for illustrative purposes and should not be considered a GAAP or non-GAAP financial measure. Synergies represent management&#8217;s combined estimate of pre-tax synergies, supply chain efficiencies and Full Potential improvements, as a result of the integration of Newmont&#8217;s and Newcrest&#8217;s businesses that have been monetized for the purposes of the estimation. Such estimates are necessarily imprecise and are based on numerous judgments and assumptions. See cautionary statement at the end of this release regarding forward-looking statements.</font></div><div><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:3.9pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:115%;position:relative;top:-2.1pt;vertical-align:baseline">7</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:6pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:115%"> See discussion of outlook and cautionary statement at the end of this release regarding forward-looking statements.</font></div><div style="height:36pt;position:relative;width:100%"><div style="bottom:0;position:absolute;width:100%"><div style="margin-top:2pt"><font style="color:#0c2b82;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:8pt;font-weight:400;line-height:115%">NEWMONT FIRST</font><font style="color:#0c2b82;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:8pt;font-weight:700;line-height:115%"> </font><font style="color:#0c2b82;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:8pt;font-weight:400;line-height:115%">QUARTER 2024 RESULTS &#124; NEWS RELEASE       &#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;1</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:8pt;font-weight:400;line-height:115%">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;</font></div><div><font><br></font></div></div></div><div id="i1e827d86a1ae43c48db71ec85dd6ef61_4"></div><hr style="page-break-after:always"><div style="min-height:99pt;width:100%"><div><img alt="image.jpg" src="image.jpg" style="height:98px;margin-bottom:5pt;vertical-align:text-bottom;width:818px"></div></div><div style="margin-top:11pt"><font style="color:#0c2b82;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:14pt;font-weight:700;line-height:115%">Advancing Portfolio Optimization with Sale of Lundin Gold Financing Facilities</font></div><div style="margin-top:6pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">Newmont announced today that Lundin Gold Inc. (Lundin Gold) has agreed to buy out 100 percent of the balance of the stream credit facility agreement and offtake agreement for the Fruta del Norte gold mine in Ecuador for total consideration of $330 million, payable in cash in two tranches&#58; $180 million as of the expected closing date of June 28, 2024, and the remaining $150 million by September 30, 2024. Newmont has maintained its exposure to the Fruta del Norte operation through its equity interest in Lundin Gold.</font></div><div><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%"> </font></div><div><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">In connection with the acquisition of Newcrest and the Company's strategy to create lasting value, Newmont committed to delivering at least $2 billion in near-term cash improvements through portfolio optimization within the first two years. The early repayment of the facilities is another step in delivering on this commitment as Newmont continues to build a more profitable and resilient future for the business.</font></div><div><font><br></font></div><div><font style="color:#0c2b82;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:14pt;font-weight:700;line-height:120%">Summary of First Quarter solid #0c2b82;border-top:0.5pt solid #0c2b82;padding:2px 1pt 2px 0;text-align:right;vertical-align:bottom"></td><td colspan="3" style="display:none"></td><td colspan="3" style="display:none"></td><td colspan="3" style="display:none"></td><td style="background-color:#d9e8ec;border-bottom:0.5pt solid #0c2b82;border-top:0.5pt solid #0c2b82;padding:2px 0 2px Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:400;line-height:100%">(74)</font></td><td style="background-color:#d9e8ec;border-bottom:0.5pt solid #0c2b82;border-top:0.5pt solid #0c2b82;padding:2px 1pt 2px 0;text-align:right;vertical-align:bottom"></td></tr></table></div><div style="margin-top:12pt"><font style="color:#0c2b82;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:700;line-height:120%">FIRST QUARTER 2024 FINANCIAL AND PRODUCTION SUMMARY</font></div><div><font><br></font></div><div><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:700;line-height:115%">Attributable gold production</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:5.85pt;font-weight:700;line-height:115%;position:relative;top:-3.15pt;vertical-align:baseline">1</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:400;line-height:115%"> decreased 4 percent to 1,675 thousand ounces from the prior quarter primarily due to lower production at Tanami due to a planned mill shutdown and seasonal rainfall impacts, and the ongoing stripping campaigns at Boddington and Akyem. In addition, lower production was delivered from the non-managed joint venture at Nevada Gold Mines. This unfavorable impact was partially offset by higher production at Pe&#241;asquito and Yanacocha, as well as a full quarter of ownership of the sites acquired in the Newcrest transaction. Full year production for 2024 is expected to be second-half weighted as previously indicated.</font></div><div><font><br></font></div><div><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:400;line-height:115%">Looking ahead, operations at Cerro Negro are currently suspended as a full investigation is conducted following the tragic fatalities of two members of the Newmont workforce on April 9, 2024. In addition, operations are temporarily suspended at Telfer, one of Newmont's non-core assets, as further work is completed to remediate the safe operation of the tailings storage facility.</font></div><div style="margin-top:8pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:700;line-height:120%">Average realized gold price</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%"> was $2,090, an increase of $86 per ounce over the prior quarter. Average realized gold price includes $2,082 per ounce of gross price received, a favorable impact of $19 per ounce mark-to-market on provisionally-priced sales and reductions of $11 per ounce for treatment and refining charges.</font></div><div style="margin-top:6pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:700;line-height:120%">Gold CAS</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:5.85pt;font-weight:700;line-height:120%;position:relative;top:-3.15pt;vertical-align:baseline">2</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%"> totaled $1.7 billion for the quarter.</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:700;line-height:120%"> Gold CAS per ounce</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:5.85pt;font-weight:700;line-height:120%;position:relative;top:-3.15pt;vertical-align:baseline">3</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%"> was largely in line with the prior quarter at $1,057 per ounce.</font></div><div style="margin-top:6pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:700;line-height:120%">Gold AISC per ounce</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:5.85pt;font-weight:700;line-height:120%;position:relative;top:-3.15pt;vertical-align:baseline">3</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%"> was largely in line with the prior quarter at $1,439 per ounce, with a slight improvement from lower sustaining capital spend.</font></div><div style="height:36pt;position:relative;width:100%"><div style="bottom:0;position:absolute;width:100%"><div style="margin-top:2pt"><font style="color:#0c2b82;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:8pt;font-weight:400;line-height:115%">NEWMONT FIRST</font><font style="color:#0c2b82;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:8pt;font-weight:700;line-height:115%"> </font><font style="color:#0c2b82;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:8pt;font-weight:400;line-height:115%">QUARTER 2024 RESULTS &#124; NEWS RELEASE       &#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;2</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:8pt;font-weight:400;line-height:115%">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;</font></div><div><font><br></font></div></div></div><hr style="page-break-after:always"><div style="min-height:99pt;width:100%"><div><img alt="image.jpg" src="image.jpg" style="height:98px;margin-bottom:5pt;vertical-align:text-bottom;width:818px"></div></div><div style="margin-top:6pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:700;line-height:120%">Attributable gold equivalent ounce (GEO) production from other metals</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%"> increased 69 percent to 489 thousand ounces from the prior quarter primarily due to the ramp-up of Pe&#241;asquito to full operations after the resolution of the labor strike in the fourth quarter of 2023, combined with higher co-product grades from the Chile Colorado pit. In addition, Cadia delivered higher copper production.</font></div><div style="margin-top:6pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:700;line-height:120%">CAS from other metals</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:5.85pt;font-weight:700;line-height:120%;position:relative;top:-3.15pt;vertical-align:baseline">2</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%"> totaled $416 million for the quarter. </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:700;line-height:120%">CAS per GEO</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:5.85pt;font-weight:700;line-height:120%;position:relative;top:-3.15pt;vertical-align:baseline">3</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%"> decreased 34 percent to $829 per ounce from the prior quarter primarily due to higher other metal sales as a result of the increased volumes at Pe&#241;asquito. </font></div><div style="margin-top:6pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:700;line-height:120%">AISC per GEO</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:5.85pt;font-weight:700;line-height:120%;position:relative;top:-3.15pt;vertical-align:baseline">3</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%"> decreased 33 percent to $1,148 per ounce compared to the prior quarter primarily due to lower CAS per GEO as a result of the increased volumes at Pe&#241;asquito, as well as lower sustaining capital spend.</font></div><div style="margin-top:6pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:700;line-height:120%">Net income from continuing operations attributable to Newmont stockholders </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">was $166 million or $0.15 per diluted share, an increase of $3.3 billion from the prior quarter primarily due to the recognition of impairment charges and higher reclamation and remediation expense during the fourth quarter of 2023, as well as higher average realized gold prices and lower CAS in the first quarter of 2024.</font></div><div style="margin-top:6pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:700;line-height:120%">Adjusted net income</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:5.85pt;font-weight:700;line-height:120%;position:relative;top:-3.15pt;vertical-align:baseline">4</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:700;line-height:120%"> </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">was $630 million or $0.55 per diluted share,</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:700;line-height:120%"> </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">compared to $452 million or $0.46 per diluted share in the prior quarter. Primary adjustments to first quarter net income include a loss on assets held for sale of $485 million, changes in the fair value of investments of $31 million, Newcrest transaction and integration costs of $29 million and settlement costs of $21 million. </font></div><div style="margin-top:6pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:700;line-height:120%">Adjusted EBITDA</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:5.85pt;font-weight:700;line-height:120%;position:relative;top:-3.15pt;vertical-align:baseline">4</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%"> increased 23 percent to $1,694 million for the quarter, compared to $1,382 million for the prior quarter. </font></div><div style="margin-top:6pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:700;line-height:120%">Consolidated cash from operations before working capital</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:5.85pt;font-weight:700;line-height:120%;position:relative;top:-3.15pt;vertical-align:baseline">5</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%"> increased 86 percent from the prior quarter to $1.4 billion primarily due to higher realized gold prices, lower CAS and lower Newcrest transaction and integration costs.</font></div><div style="margin-top:6pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:700;line-height:120%">Consolidated net cash from operating activities</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%"> increased 26 percent from the prior quarter to $776 million primarily due to the improvement in cash from operations described above, partially offset by a $666 million reduction in operating cash flow due to changes in working capital, including a $291&#160;million stamp duty payment in connection with the Newcrest acquisition, a build in inventories, stockpiles and ore on leach pads of $193 million, a build in accounts receivable of $84 million and reclamation spend of $59 million, primarily related to the construction of the Yanacocha water treatment facilities.</font></div><div style="margin-top:6pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:700;line-height:120%">Free Cash Flow</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:5.85pt;font-weight:700;line-height:120%;position:relative;top:-3.15pt;vertical-align:baseline">7 </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">was $(74) million compared to $(304) million in the prior quarter primarily due to lower sustaining and development capital expenditures.</font></div><div style="margin-top:6pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:700;line-height:120%">Capital expenditures</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:5.85pt;font-weight:700;line-height:120%;position:relative;top:-3.15pt;vertical-align:baseline">6</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%"> decreased 8 percent from the prior quarter to $850 million primarily due to lower sustaining and development capital spend. Development capital expenditures in 2024 primarily relate to Ahafo North, Tanami Expansion 2, Cadia Block Caves and Cerro Negro expansion projects.</font></div><div style="margin-top:6pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:700;line-height:120%">Balance sheet and liquidity </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">remained strong in the first quarter, ending the quarter with $2.3 billion of consolidated cash, cash of $342 million included in</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:120%"> Current assets held for sale</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">, with approximately $6.7 billion of total liquidity&#59; reported net debt to adjusted EBITDA of 1.2x</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:5.85pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%;position:relative;top:-3.15pt;vertical-align:baseline">8</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">.</font></div><div style="margin-top:6pt"><font><br></font></div><div><font style="color:#0c2b82;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:700;line-height:120%">NON-MANAGED JOINT VENTURE AND EQUITY METHOD INVESTMENTS</font><font style="color:#0c2b82;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:5.85pt;font-weight:700;line-height:120%;position:relative;top:-3.15pt;vertical-align:baseline">9</font></div><div style="margin-top:6pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:700;line-height:120%">Nevada Gold Mines (NGM) </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">attributable gold production was 264 thousand ounces, with CAS of $1,177 per ounce</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:5.85pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%;position:relative;top:-3.15pt;vertical-align:baseline">3</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%"> and AISC of $1,576 per ounce</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:5.85pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%;position:relative;top:-3.15pt;vertical-align:baseline">3</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%"> for the first quarter.</font></div><div style="margin-bottom:6pt;margin-top:6pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:700;line-height:120%">Pueblo Viejo (PV) </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">attributable gold production was 54 thousand ounces for the quarter. Cash distributions received for the Company's equity method investment in Pueblo Viejo totaled $45 million in the first quarter. Capital contributions of $9 million were made during the quarter related to the expansion project at Pueblo Viejo.</font></div><div style="margin-bottom:6pt;margin-top:6pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:700;line-height:120%">Fruta del Norte </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">attributable gold production is reported on a quarter lag. Production reported in the first quarter of 2024 was 21 thousand ounces. Cash distributions received from the Company's equity method investment in Fruta del Norte were $8 million for the first quarter.</font></div><div><table style="border-collapse:collapse;display:inline-table;margin-bottom:5pt;vertical-align:text-bottom;width:37.083%"><tr><td style="width:1.0%"></td><td style="width:98.900%"></td><td style="width:0.1%"></td></tr><tr style="height:3pt"><td colspan="3" style="border-top:1pt solid #000;padding:0 1pt"></td></tr></table></div><div><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:4.55pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:115%;position:relative;top:-2.44pt;vertical-align:baseline">1</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:7pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:115%"> Attributable gold production includes ounces from the Company's equity method investment in Pueblo Viejo (40%) and in Lundin Gold (31.9%).</font></div><div><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:4.55pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:115%;position:relative;top:-2.44pt;vertical-align:baseline">2</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:7pt;font-weight:400;line-height:115%"> </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:7pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:115%">Consolidated Costs applicable to sales (CAS) excludes Depreciation and amortization and Reclamation and remediation.</font></div><div><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:4.55pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:115%;position:relative;top:-2.44pt;vertical-align:baseline">3</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:7pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:115%"> Non-GAAP measure. See end of this release for reconciliation to Costs applicable to sales.</font></div><div><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:4.55pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:115%;position:relative;top:-2.44pt;vertical-align:baseline">4</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:7pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:115%"> Non-GAAP measure. See end of this release for reconciliation to Net income (loss) attributable to Newmont stockholders.</font></div><div><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:4.55pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:115%;position:relative;top:-2.44pt;vertical-align:baseline">5</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:7pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:115%"> Cash from operations before working capital is a non-GAAP metric with the most directly comparable GAAP financial metric being to Net cash provided by (used in) operating activities, as shown reconciled in the Condensed Consolidated Statements of Cash Flows.</font></div><div><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:4.55pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:115%;position:relative;top:-2.44pt;vertical-align:baseline">6</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:7pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:115%"> Capital expenditures refers to Additions to property plant and mine development from the Consolidated Statements of Cash Flows.</font></div><div><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:4.55pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:115%;position:relative;top:-2.44pt;vertical-align:baseline">7</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:7pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:115%"> Non-GAAP measure. See end of this release for reconciliation to Net cash provided by operating activities. Excluding the stamp duty payment in connection with the Newcrest transaction, Newmont generated Free Cash Flow of $217 million.</font></div><div><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:4.55pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:115%;position:relative;top:-2.44pt;vertical-align:baseline">8</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:7pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:115%"> Non-GAAP measure. See end of this release for reconciliation.</font></div><div><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:4.55pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:115%;position:relative;top:-2.44pt;vertical-align:baseline">9</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:7pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:115%"> Newmont has a 38.5% interest in Nevada Gold Mines, which is accounted for using the proportionate consolidation method. In addition, Newmont has a 40% interest in Pueblo Viejo, which is accounted for as an equity method investment, as well as a 31.9% interest in Lundin Gold, who wholly owns and operates the Fruta del Norte mine, which is accounted for as an equity method investment on a quarter lag.</font></div><div style="height:36pt;position:relative;width:100%"><div style="bottom:0;position:absolute;width:100%"><div style="margin-top:2pt"><font style="color:#0c2b82;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:8pt;font-weight:400;line-height:115%">NEWMONT FIRST</font><font style="color:#0c2b82;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:8pt;font-weight:700;line-height:115%"> </font><font style="color:#0c2b82;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:8pt;font-weight:400;line-height:115%">QUARTER 2024 RESULTS &#124; NEWS RELEASE       &#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;3</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:8pt;font-weight:400;line-height:115%">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;</font></div><div><font><br></font></div></div></div><div id="i1e827d86a1ae43c48db71ec85dd6ef61_7"></div><hr style="page-break-after:always"><div style="min-height:99pt;width:100%"><div><img alt="image.jpg" src="image.jpg" style="height:98px;margin-bottom:5pt;vertical-align:text-bottom;width:818px"></div></div><div style="margin-bottom:8pt;margin-top:12pt"><font style="color:#0c2b82;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:14pt;font-weight:700;line-height:115%">Key Projects in Execution</font></div><div style="margin-bottom:6pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">Newmont&#8217;s project pipeline supports stable production with improving margins and mine life</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:5.85pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%;position:relative;top:-3.15pt;vertical-align:baseline">1</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">. Newmont's 2024 outlook includes current development capital costs and production related to the key projects of Tanami Expansion 2, Ahafo North and Cadia Block Caves.</font></div><div style="margin-bottom:6pt;padding-left:36pt;text-indent:-18pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">&#9642;</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%;padding-left:15.37pt;text-decoration:underline">Tanami Expansion 2</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%"> (Australia) secures Tanami&#8217;s future as a long-life, low-cost producer by extending mine life beyond 2040 through the addition of a 1,460 meter hoisting shaft and supporting infrastructure to process 3.3 million tonnes per year and provide a platform for future growth. The expansion is expected to increase average annual gold production by approximately 150 to 200 thousand ounces per year for the first five years and reduce operating costs by approximately 30 percent, bringing average all-in sustaining costs to $900 to $1,000 per ounce for Tanami (2028 - 2032). As a result of the identification of required overbreak and underbreak remediation, commercial production for the project is now expected in the second half of 2027. Total capital costs are now estimated to be between $1.7 and $1.8 billion, incorporating the required remediation work. Development costs (excluding capitalized interest) since approval were $806&#160;million, of which $54 million related to 2024. </font></div><div style="margin-bottom:6pt;padding-left:36pt;text-indent:-18pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">&#9642;</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%;padding-left:15.37pt;text-decoration:underline">Ahafo North</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%"> (Ghana) expands our existing footprint in Ghana with four open pit mines and a stand-alone mill located approximately 30 kilometers from the Company&#8217;s Ahafo South operations. The project is expected to add between 275 and 325 thousand ounces per year with all-in sustaining costs of $800 to $900 per ounce for the first five full years of production (2026 - 2030). Ahafo North is the best unmined gold deposit in West Africa with approximately 4.1 million ounces of Reserves and 1.3 million ounces of Measured, Indicated and Inferred Resources</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:5.85pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%;position:relative;top:-3.15pt;vertical-align:baseline">2</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%"> and significant upside potential to extend beyond Ahafo North&#8217;s current 13-year mine life. Commercial production for the project is expected in the second half of 2025. Total capital costs are estimated to be between $950 and $1,050 million. Development costs (excluding capitalized interest) since approval were $434 million, of which $59 million related to 2024. </font></div><div style="margin-bottom:6pt;padding-left:36pt;text-indent:-18pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">&#9642;</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%;padding-left:15.37pt;text-decoration:underline">Cadia Block Caves</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%"> (Australia) includes two existing panel caves to recover approximately 5.9 million ounces of Gold Reserves as well as 1.3 million tonnes of Copper Reserves. First ore has been delivered from the first panel cave (PC2-3), and development is underway at the second panel cave (PC1-2). The newly-acquired project is currently under review, and a more fulsome update on the anticipated metrics is expected to be provided in the second half of 2024. Development capital costs (excluding capitalized interest) since approval were $76 million, of which $40 million related to 2024.</font></div><div style="margin-bottom:6pt"><font><br></font></div><div style="margin-bottom:8pt;margin-top:12pt"><font style="color:#0c2b82;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:14pt;font-weight:700;line-height:115%">Committed to Concurrent Reclamation </font></div><div style="margin-bottom:6pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">Since mines operate for a finite period, careful closure planning is crucial to address the diverse social, economic, environmental and regulatory impacts associated with the end of mining operations. Newmont&#8217;s global Closure Strategy integrates closure planning throughout each operation&#8217;s lifespan, aiming to create enduring positive and sustainable legacies that last long after mining ceases. Newmont continues to accrue to reclamation and remediation spend through the year. Newmont expects to incur a cash outflow of approximately $600 million in 2024 and $700 million in 2025, primarily related to the construction of two new water treatment plants and post-closure management at Yanacocha. The operation&#8217;s ongoing closure planning study advanced to the feasibility state in December 2023 and continues to address several complex closure issues, including water management, social impacts and tailings. A long-term water management solution will replace five existing water treatment facilities with two, addressing the watersheds along the continental divide. Certain estimated costs remain subject to revision as ongoing study work and assessment of opportunities that incorporates the latest design considerations remain in progress. </font></div><div style="margin-bottom:6pt"><font><br></font></div><div style="margin-bottom:6pt"><font><br></font></div><div style="margin-bottom:6pt"><font><br></font></div><div style="margin-bottom:6pt"><font><br></font></div><div style="margin-bottom:6pt"><font><br></font></div><div style="margin-bottom:6pt"><font><br></font></div><div style="margin-top:15pt"><table style="border-collapse:collapse;display:inline-table;margin-bottom:5pt;vertical-align:text-bottom;width:37.083%"><tr><td style="width:1.0%"></td><td style="width:98.900%"></td><td style="width:0.1%"></td></tr><tr style="height:3pt"><td colspan="3" style="border-top:1pt solid #000;padding:0 1pt"></td></tr></table></div><div><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:4.55pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:100%;position:relative;top:-2.44pt;vertical-align:baseline">1</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:7pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:100%"> Project estimates remain subject to change based upon uncertainties, including future market conditions, macroeconomic and geopolitical conditions, changes in interest</font></div><div><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:7pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:100%">rates, inflation, commodities and raw materials prices, supply chain disruptions, labor markets, engineering and mine plan assumptions, future funding decisions,</font></div><div><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:7pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:100%">consideration of strategic capital allocation and other factors, which may impact estimated capital expenditures, AISC and timing of projects. See end of this release for</font></div><div style="margin-bottom:2pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:7pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:100%">cautionary statement regarding forward-looking statements. </font></div><div><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:4.55pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:120%;position:relative;top:-2.44pt;vertical-align:baseline">2</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:7pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:120%"> Total resources presented for Ahafo North includes Measured and Indicated resources of 1 million gold ounces and Inferred resources of 300 thousand gold ounces. See cautionary statement at the end of this release. </font></div><div style="height:36pt;position:relative;width:100%"><div style="bottom:0;position:absolute;width:100%"><div style="margin-top:2pt"><font style="color:#0c2b82;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:8pt;font-weight:400;line-height:115%">NEWMONT FIRST</font><font style="color:#0c2b82;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:8pt;font-weight:700;line-height:115%"> </font><font style="color:#0c2b82;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:8pt;font-weight:400;line-height:115%">QUARTER 2024 RESULTS &#124; NEWS RELEASE       &#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;4</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:8pt;font-weight:400;line-height:115%">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;</font></div><div><font><br></font></div></div></div><div id="i1e827d86a1ae43c48db71ec85dd6ef61_10"></div><hr style="page-break-after:always"><div style="min-height:99pt;width:100%"><div><img alt="image.jpg" src="image.jpg" style="height:98px;margin-bottom:5pt;vertical-align:text-bottom;width:818px"></div></div><div style="margin-bottom:3pt;margin-top:2pt"><font style="color:#0c2b82;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:14pt;font-weight:700;line-height:115%">Newmont's 2024 Outlook</font></div><div style="margin-top:3pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">For a more detailed discussion, see the Company&#8217;s 2024 Outlook released on February 22, 2024, available on Newmont.com. Please see the cautionary statement and footnotes for additional information.</font></div><div style="margin-top:3pt"><table Sans',sans-serif;font-size:8pt;font-weight:400;line-height:110%"> 2024 outlook projections are considered forward-looking statements and represent management&#8217;s good faith estimates or expectations of future production results as of February 22, 2024. Outlook is based upon certain assumptions, including, but not limited to, metal prices, oil prices, certain exchange rates and other assumptions. For example, 2024 Outlook assumes $1,900&#47;oz Au, $8,818&#47;tonne Cu, $23.00&#47;oz Ag, $2,976&#47;tonne Zn, $2,205&#47;tonne Pb, $0.70 AUD&#47;USD exchange rate, $0.75 CAD&#47;USD exchange rate and $90&#47;barrel WTI. Production, CAS, AISC and capital estimates exclude projects that have not yet been approved. The potential impact on inventory valuation as a result of lower prices, input costs, and project decisions are not included as part of this Outlook. Assumptions used for purposes of Outlook may prove to be incorrect and actual results may differ from those anticipated, including variation beyond a +&#47;-5% range. Outlook cannot be guaranteed. As such, investors are cautioned not to place undue reliance upon Outlook and forward-looking statements as there can be no assurance that the plans, assumptions or expectations upon which they are placed will occur. Amounts may not recalculate to totals due to rounding. See cautionary at the end of this release. </font></div><div style="margin-bottom:2pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:5.2pt;font-weight:400;line-height:110%;position:relative;top:-2.8pt;vertical-align:baseline">b </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:8pt;font-weight:400;line-height:110%">All-in sustaining costs (AISC) as used in the Company&#8217;s Outlook is a non-GAAP metric&#59; see below for further information and reconciliation to consolidated 2024 CAS outlook.</font></div><div style="margin-bottom:2pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:5.2pt;font-weight:400;line-height:110%;position:relative;top:-2.8pt;vertical-align:baseline">c </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:8pt;font-weight:400;line-height:110%">Consolidated production for Merian is presented on a total production basis for the mine site&#59; attributable production represents a 75% interest for Merian.</font></div><div style="margin-bottom:2pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:5.2pt;font-weight:400;line-height:110%;position:relative;top:-2.8pt;vertical-align:baseline">d </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:8pt;font-weight:400;line-height:110%">Represents the ownership interest in the Nevada Gold Mines (NGM) joint venture. NGM is owned 38.5% by Newmont and owned 61.5% and operated by Barrick. The Company accounts for its interest in NGM using the proportionate consolidation method, thereby recognizing its pro-rata share of the assets, liabilities and operations of NGM. </font></div><div style="margin-bottom:2pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:5.2pt;font-weight:400;line-height:110%;position:relative;top:-2.8pt;vertical-align:baseline">e </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:8pt;font-weight:400;line-height:110%">Attributable production includes Newmont&#8217;s 40% interest in Pueblo Viejo, which is accounted for as an equity method investment.</font></div><div style="margin-bottom:2pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:7pt;font-weight:400;line-height:100%">&#160;</font></td><td style="background-color:#d9e8ec;border-bottom:3pt double #000;border-top:1pt solid #000;padding:2px 1pt 2px 0;text-align:right;vertical-align:middle"></td></tr></table></div><div style="margin-bottom:3pt;padding-left:9pt;text-indent:-9pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:4.87pt;font-weight:400;line-height:115%;position:relative;top:-2.62pt;vertical-align:baseline">(1)</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:7.5pt;font-weight:400;line-height:115%;padding-left:3.34pt">Attributable gold ounces sold excludes ounces related to the Pueblo Viejo mine, which is 40% owned by Newmont and accounted for as an equity method investment, and the Fruta del Norte mine, which is wholly owned by Lundin Gold whom the Company holds a 31.9% interest and is accounted for as an equity method investment. </font></div><div style="padding-left:9pt;text-indent:-9pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:4.87pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%;position:relative;top:-2.62pt;vertical-align:baseline">(2)</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:7.5pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%;padding-left:3.34pt">For the three months ended June 30, 2023 and September 30, 2023, Pe&#241;asquito production was impacted due to the suspension of operations as a result of the Union labor strike. Sales activity recognized in the third quarter of 2023 was related to adjustments on provisionally price concentrate sales subject to final settlement. Consequently, price per ounce&#47;pound metrics are not meaningful (&#34;N.M&#34;).</font></div><div style="padding-left:9pt;text-indent:-9pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:4.87pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%;position:relative;top:-2.62pt;vertical-align:baseline">(3)</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:7.5pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%;padding-left:3.34pt">Represents attributable gold from Newmont's 40% interest in Pueblo Viejo, which is accounted for as an equity method investment. Attributable gold ounces produced at Pueblo Viejo are not included in attributable gold ounces sold, as noted in footnote (1). Income and expenses of equity method investments are included in </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:7.5pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">Equity income (loss) of affiliates</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:7.5pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">. </font></div><div style="padding-left:9pt;text-indent:-9pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:4.87pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%;position:relative;top:-2.62pt;vertical-align:baseline">(4)</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:7.5pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%;padding-left:3.34pt">Represents attributable gold from Newmont's 31.9% interest in Lundin Gold, who wholly owns and operates the Fruta del Norte mine, which is accounted for on a quarterly-lag as an equity method investment. Attributable gold ounces produced by Lundin Gold represent prior quarter production and are not included in attributable gold ounces sold, as noted in footnote (1). Income and expenses of equity method investments are included in </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:7.5pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">Equity income (loss) of affiliates</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:7.5pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">. </font></div><div style="padding-left:9pt;text-indent:-9pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:4.87pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%;position:relative;top:-2.62pt;vertical-align:baseline">(5)</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:7.5pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%;padding-left:3.34pt">Sites are classified as held for sale as of March 31, 2024. </font></div><div style="padding-left:9pt;text-indent:-9pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:4.87pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%;position:relative;top:-2.62pt;vertical-align:baseline">(6)</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:7.5pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%;padding-left:3.34pt">Non-GAAP measure. See end of this release for reconciliation.</font></div><div style="height:36pt;position:relative;width:100%"><div style="bottom:0;position:absolute;width:100%"><div style="margin-top:2pt"><font held for sale in 2024. </font></div><div style="padding-left:18pt;text-indent:-18pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:7.5pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">, primarily represents unrealized gains and losses related to the Company's investment in current and non-current marketable equity securities. </font></div><div style="padding-left:18pt;text-indent:-18pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:7.5pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">, represents costs incurred related to Newmont's acquisition of Newcrest completed in 2023 as well as subsequent integration costs. </font></div><div style="padding-left:18pt;text-indent:-18pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:4.87pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%;position:relative;top:-2.62pt;vertical-align:baseline">(5)</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:7.5pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%;padding-left:12.34pt">Settlement costs, included in </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open style="padding-left:18pt;text-indent:-18pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open inventories.</font></div><div style="padding-left:18pt;text-indent:-18pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:7.5pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">Other income (loss), net</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:7.5pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">, primarily represents the gain recognized on the purchase and sale of foreign currency bonds. </font></div><div style="padding-left:18pt;text-indent:-18pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:4.87pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%;position:relative;top:-2.62pt;vertical-align:baseline">(8)</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:7.5pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">, primarily represents severance and related costs associated with significant organizational or operating model changes implemented by the Company.</font></div><div style="padding-left:18pt;text-indent:-18pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:4.87pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%;position:relative;top:-2.62pt;vertical-align:baseline">(9)</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:7.5pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%;padding-left:12.34pt">Reclamation and remediation charges, included in </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:7.5pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">Reclamation and remediation</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:7.5pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">, represent revisions to reclamation and remediation plans at the Company's former operating properties and historic mining operations that have entered the closure phase and have no substantive future economic value. </font></div><div style="padding-left:18pt;text-indent:-18pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:4.87pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%;position:relative;top:-2.62pt;vertical-align:baseline">(10)</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:7.5pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%;padding-left:9.56pt">The tax effect of adjustments, included in </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:7.5pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">Income and mining tax benefit (expense)</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:7.5pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">, represents the tax effect of adjustments in footnotes (2) through (9), as described above, and are calculated using the applicable regional tax rate.</font></div><div style="padding-left:18pt;text-indent:-18pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:4.87pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%;position:relative;top:-2.62pt;vertical-align:baseline">(11)</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:7.5pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%;padding-left:9.56pt">Valuation allowance and other tax adjustments, included in </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:7.5pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">Income and mining tax benefit (expense)</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:7.5pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">, is recorded for items such as foreign tax credits, capital losses, disallowed foreign losses, and the effects of changes in foreign currency exchange rates on deferred tax assets and deferred tax liabilities. The adjustment for the three months ended March&#160;31, 2024 reflects the net increase or (decrease) to net operating losses, capital losses, tax credit carryovers, and other deferred tax assets subject to valuation allowance of $(65), the effects of changes in foreign exchange rates on deferred tax assets and liabilities of $35, net reductions to the reserve for uncertain tax positions of $(2), recording of a deferred tax liability for the outside basis difference at Akyem of $117 due to the status change to held-for-sale, and other tax adjustments of $7. </font></div><div style="padding-left:18pt;text-indent:-18pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open subsequent sale of the Triple Flag investment. </font></div><div style="margin-bottom:2pt;padding-left:18pt;text-indent:-18pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:7.5pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%;padding-left:12.34pt">Impairment charges, included in </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:7.5pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">Other expense, net</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:7.5pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">, represents non-cash write-downs of various assets that are no longer in use and materials and supplies inventories.</font></div><div style="padding-left:18pt;text-indent:-18pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:4.87pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%;position:relative;top:-2.62pt;vertical-align:baseline">(5)</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:7.5pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%;padding-left:12.34pt">Restructuring and severance, included in </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:7.5pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">Other expense, net</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:7.5pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">, primarily represents severance and related costs associated with significant organizational or operating model changes implemented by the Company.</font></div><div style="margin-bottom:2pt;padding-left:18pt;text-indent:-18pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:4.87pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%;position:relative;top:-2.62pt;vertical-align:baseline">(6)</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:7.5pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%;padding-left:12.34pt">Other</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">,</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:7.5pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%"> included in</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:7.5pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:120%"> Other income (loss), net</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:7.5pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">, primarily represents income received on the favorable settlement of certain matters that were outstanding at the time of sale of the related investment in 2022.</font></div><div style="margin-bottom:2pt;padding-left:18pt;text-indent:-18pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:4.87pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%;position:relative;top:-2.62pt;vertical-align:baseline">(7)</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:7.5pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%;padding-left:12.34pt">The tax effect of adjustments, included in </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:7.5pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">Income and mining tax benefit (expense)</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:7.5pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">, represents the tax effect of adjustments in footnotes (2) through (6), as described above, and are calculated using the applicable regional tax rate.</font></div><div style="padding-left:18pt;text-indent:-18pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:4.87pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%;position:relative;top:-2.62pt;vertical-align:baseline">(8)</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:7.5pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%;padding-left:12.34pt">Valuation allowance and other tax adjustments, included in</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:7.5pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:120%"> Income and mining tax benefit (expense)</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:7.5pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">, is recorded for items such as foreign tax credits, capital losses, disallowed foreign losses, and the effects of changes in foreign currency exchange rates on deferred tax assets and deferred tax liabilities. The adjustment for the three months ended March&#160;31, 2023 reflects the net increase or (decrease) to net operating losses, capital losses, tax credit carryovers, and other deferred tax assets subject to valuation allowance of $10, the effects of changes in foreign exchange rates on deferred tax assets and liabilities of $17, net reductions to the reserve for uncertain tax positions of $11, other tax adjustments of $2. </font></div><div style="margin-bottom:2pt;padding-left:18pt;text-indent:-18pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:4.87pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%;position:relative;top:-2.62pt;vertical-align:baseline">(9)</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:7.5pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%;padding-left:12.34pt">Adjusted net income (loss) per diluted share is calculated using diluted common shares in accordance with securities.</font></div><div style="padding-left:18pt;text-indent:-18pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:7.5pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">, represents costs incurred related to Newmont's acquisition of Newcrest completed in 2023 as well as subsequent integration costs. </font></div><div style="padding-left:18pt;text-indent:-18pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:7.5pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">, are primarily comprised of wind-down and demobilization costs related to the French Guiana project in 2024 and litigation expenses in 2023.</font></div><div style="padding-left:18pt;text-indent:-18pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:7.5pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">, represents non-cash write-downs of various assets that are no longer in use and materials and supplies inventories.</font></div><div style="padding-left:18pt;text-indent:-18pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:7.5pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">Other income (loss), net</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:7.5pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">, in 2024 primarily represent the purchase and sale of foreign currency bonds. For 2023, primarily comprised of the net gain recognized on the exchange of the previously held Maverix investment for Triple Flag and the subsequent sale of the Triple Flag investment.</font></div><div style="padding-left:18pt;text-indent:-18pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:4.87pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%;position:relative;top:-2.62pt;vertical-align:baseline">(7)</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:7.5pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">Other expense, net</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:7.5pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">, primarily represents severance and related costs associated with significant organizational or operating model changes implemented by the Company for all periods presented.</font></div><div style="padding-left:18pt;text-indent:-18pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:4.87pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%;position:relative;top:-2.62pt;vertical-align:baseline">(8)</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:7.5pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">Reclamation and remediation</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:7.5pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">, represent revisions to reclamation and remediation plans at the Company's former operating properties and historic mining operations that have entered the closure phase and have no substantive future economic value. </font></div><div style="padding-left:18pt;text-indent:-18pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:4.87pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%;position:relative;top:-2.62pt;vertical-align:baseline">(9)</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:7.5pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">Other income (loss), net</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:7.5pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">, in 2023, represents income received during the first quarter of 2023, on the favorable settlement of certain matters that were outstanding at the time of sale of the related investment in 2022.</font></div><div><font><br></font></div><div style="height:36pt;position:relative;width:100%"><div style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:400;line-height:100%">(350)</font></td><td style="padding:2px 1pt 2px 0;text-align:right;vertical-align:bottom"></td></tr></table></div><div style="margin-top:2pt;padding-left:18pt;text-indent:-18pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:5.2pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%;position:relative;top:-2.8pt;vertical-align:baseline">(1)</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:8pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%;padding-left:11.97pt">Includes payment of $291 for stamp duty tax, related to the Newcrest transaction, in the first quarter of 2024.</font></div><div style="padding-left:18pt;text-indent:-18pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:5.2pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%;position:relative;top:-2.8pt;vertical-align:baseline">(2)</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:8pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:120%;padding-left:11.97pt">Net cash provided by (used in) investing activities </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:8pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">includes</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:8pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:120%"> Additions to property, plant and mine development,</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:8pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%"> which is included in the Company&#8217;s computation of Free Cash Flow.</font></div><div id="i1e827d86a1ae43c48db71ec85dd6ef61_37"></div><div style="margin-bottom:12pt;margin-top:12pt;padding-left:18pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:700;line-height:120%">Attributable Free Cash Flow</font></div><div style="margin-bottom:9pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">Management uses Attributable Free Cash Flow as a non-GAAP measure to analyze cash flows generated from operations that are attributable to the Company. Attributable Free Cash Flow is </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">Net cash provided by (used in) operating activities</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%"> after deducting net cash flows from operations attributable to noncontrolling interests less </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">Net cash provided by (used in) operating activities of discontinued operations</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%"> after deducting net cash flows from discontinued operations attributable to noncontrolling interests less </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">Additions to property, plant and mine development</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%"> after deducting property, plant and mine development attributable to noncontrolling interests. The Company believes that Attributable Free Cash Flow is useful as one of the bases for comparing the Company&#8217;s performance with its competitors. Although Attributable Free Cash Flow and similar measures are frequently used as measures of cash flows generated from operations by other companies, the Company&#8217;s calculation of Attributable Free Cash Flow is not necessarily comparable to such other similarly titled captions of other companies.</font></div><div style="margin-bottom:9pt;margin-top:9pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">The presentation of non-GAAP Attributable Free Cash Flow is not meant to be considered in isolation or as an alternative to Net income attributable to Newmont stockholders as an indicator of the Company&#8217;s performance, or as an alternative to </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">Net cash provided by (used in) operating activities</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%"> as a measure of liquidity as those terms are defined by GAAP, and does not necessarily indicate whether cash flows will be sufficient to fund cash needs. The Company&#8217;s definition of Attributable Free Cash Flow is limited in that it does not represent residual cash flows available for discretionary expenditures due to the fact that the measure does not deduct the payments required for debt service and other contractual obligations or payments made for business acquisitions. Therefore, the Company believes it is important to view Attributable Free Cash Flow as a measure that provides supplemental information to the Company&#8217;s Condensed Consolidated Statements of Cash Flows.</font></div><div style="margin-top:9pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">The following tables set forth a reconciliation of Attributable Free Cash Flow, a non-GAAP financial measure, to </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">Net cash provided by (used in) operating activities</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">, which the Company believes to be the GAAP financial measure most directly comparable to Attributable Free Cash Flow, as well as information regarding </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">Net cash provided by (used in) investing activities</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%"> and </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">Net cash provided by (used in) financing activities.</font></div><div style="text-indent:36pt"><table style="border-collapse:collapse;display:inline-table;margin-bottom:5pt;vertical-align:text-bottom;width:100.000%"><tr><td style="width:1.0%"></td><td style="width:66.122%"></td><td Sans',sans-serif;font-size:7.5pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:120%;padding-left:12.34pt">Net cash provided by (used in) investing activities </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:7.5pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">includes</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:7.5pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:120%"> Additions to property, plant and mine development,</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:7.5pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%"> which is included in the Company&#8217;s computation of Free Cash Flow.</font></div><div id="i1e827d86a1ae43c48db71ec85dd6ef61_40"></div><div style="margin-top:12pt;padding-left:18pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:700;line-height:120%">Net Debt</font></div><div style="margin-bottom:6pt;margin-top:9pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">Net Debt is calculated as </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">Debt</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">, as presented on the Condensed Consolidated Balance Sheets. </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">Cash and cash equivalents </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">and time deposits are subtracted from </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">as these are highly liquid, low-risk investments and could be used to reduce the Company's debt obligations. </font></div><div style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">All-in sustaining costs represent the sum of certain costs, recognized as GAAP financial measures, that management considers to be associated with production.
